text:
Question 176) An executive always travels between cities A and B, which are located at different times. The duration of the plane travel between the two cities is 6 hours. He always takes a flight that leaves A at 15h and arrives in town B at 18h (respective local times). One day, when I arrived in city B, I knew that I needed to be back in town A at most until 1 pm the next day (local time A).
For the executive to arrive in the city at the right time and admitting that there are no delays, he must take a flight from city B, at local time of B, at most (s)
A) 16h.
B) 10h.
C) 7h.
D) 4h.
E) 1h.
